channel.title: Talawanda High School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Talawanda High School, including events, athletics, clubs, and important dates.

item.title: Food Resources for Talawanda Families
item.description:
Talawanda School District offers multiple food assistance programs for families in need:

  • Little Free Pantries available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more as needed
  • Backpack Program at all elementary buildings provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays (contact building Social Worker)
  • Emergency Food boxes available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours
  • Access a calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule, list of all Butler County food pantries, and SNAP information via the provided links

View original newsletter

item.title: Little Women Musical Performance at THS
item.description:
Little Women: The Musical will be performed by Talawanda High School Drama Club at the THS Performing Arts Center. This family-friendly Broadway musical tells Louisa May Alcott's 1868 story of the March sisters during the Civil War. Shows are December 5th at 7 PM, December 6th at 2 PM and 7 PM. Tickets are $8 and can be purchased online or with cash at the door. Nearly 20 THS students from all grades participate, with contributions from Oxford community members.

Little Women: The Musical (Evening Performance)

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule for December
item.description:
No club meetings during Thanksgiving week. December 1-6 club meetings resume with various options: - Diversity Club, Setting Stone, Tribune, Art Club, Key Club, Mock Trial, Robotics Club, Chess Club, and Project Green meeting throughout the week at various times and rooms - Drama Production of Little Women: Friday 12/5 at 7:00pm and Saturday 12/6 at 2:00pm & 7:00pm in the PAC

item.title: Butler Tech Application Window Now Open
item.description:
Butler Tech's application window is now open for 1-Year, 2-Year, and 3-Year programs. Prospective students can visit through small group tours (9AM-12PM) or open houses (4-7 PM). Small group tours are available for 2Y Programs on Dec 6, Dec 13, Jan 24, and Jan 31, and for 3Y Programs on Jan 31, Feb 7, and Feb 28. Open houses are scheduled for Jan 15, 2026 (all 2Y campuses: BSC, DRL, NSC, SOA) and March 5, 2026 (all 3Y campuses: AM Hub, Aviation, BSC, DRL). Apply here | More details

Butler Tech 2Y Programs Small Group Tour

item.title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Information
item.description:
Seniors must submit their portraits for the 2026 yearbook by March 27th. Upload photos at snap.yearbookforever.com using access code talawanda2026. Photos must be in portrait format (not landscape), greater than 1MB filesize, follow the student code of conduct, and black and white photos are discouraged.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Senior Cap and Gown Order Deadline
item.description:
Senior cap and gown orders must be placed by December 6th to receive the discounted price of $66.69. After December 6th, the price increases to $65.00 plus service/shipping and sales tax. Orders can be placed online at JOSTENS.COM or through the school during lunch (dates TBD). The gown is a rental and must be returned after graduation; students keep their cap, tassel, and stole. The Custom "Mascot Package" (flyer enclosed) includes cap, rental gown, tassel, and stole for $54.95 plus fees with online ordering.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Finals Week Schedule December 16-19
item.description:
Finals Week runs December 16-19, 2025. Students should arrive by 11:10 AM on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes with exams. Buses still depart at 2:30 PM.

Tuesday 12/16: Full day schedule with 0 Bell (7:30-7:50), regular periods, and 7th Period Exam (1:00-2:30 PM).

Wednesday 12/17: 1st Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 2nd Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Thursday 12/18: 3rd Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 4th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Friday 12/19: 5th Period Exam (7:55-9:25 AM), Break (9:25-9:40 AM), 6th Period Exam (9:40-11:10 AM).

Finals Week

item.title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
item.description:
Individual Testing (12/3-12/5): For students who still need to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not taking the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

Class Testing (12/16-12/19): ONLY for students currently taking an Algebra C or Government class, administered during exam week. Make-up testing: 1/7-1/8.

Emails will be sent to students and parents before Thanksgiving Break with specific test details. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess: hessb@talawanda.org

item.title: Community Food Resources and Support Services
item.description:
The Talawanda School District provides multiple food assistance resources for families: - Little Free Pantries are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or as needed - Backpack Program provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at all elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker) - Emergency Food Boxes available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours

Additional resources include a calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule, list of all Butler County food pantries, and SNAP information. Contact information for Social Workers at Kramer (Chelsea Pike: 513-273-3511, pikec@talawanda.org), Marshall (Chrissy Rolfes: 513-273-3611, rolfesc@talawanda.org), and Bogan (Emily White: 513-273-3403, whitee@talawanda.org), plus Success Liaisons at TMS (Lydia Schrag: 513-273-3311, schragl@talawanda.org) and THS (Chris Robertson: 513-273-3224, robertsonc@talawanda.org) is provided.

View original newsletter

item.title: Robotics Club Scrimmage at Loveland High School
item.description:
The Robotics Club will compete in a scrimmage at Loveland High School on Sunday, November 16th. The scrimmage starts at 1:00 PM, but members must arrive by 12:30 PM.

item.description:
Finals Week runs December 16-19, 2025. Students should arrive by 11:10 AM on 12/17, 12/18, and 12/19, and only need to attend classes where they have exams. Buses still depart at 2:30 PM.

Tuesday 12/16: Full day schedule with 7th Period Exam 1:00-2:30 PM

Wednesday 12/17: 1st Period Exam 7:55-9:25, Break 9:25-9:40, 2nd Period Exam 9:40-11:10

Thursday 12/18: 3rd Period Exam 7:55-9:25, Break 9:25-9:40, 4th Period Exam 9:40-11:10

Friday 12/19: 5th Period Exam 7:55-9:25, Break 9:25-9:40, 6th Period Exam 9:40-11:10

item.title: FCCLA Diaper Drive for Families in Need
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a Diaper Drive from November 3 to December 12. The goal is to collect 1,000 diapers and 21 packs of wipes for families in need. Drop off donations to Talawanda High School, Room 611, or have items delivered directly to the school (ATTN: FCCLA Kari Croucher, 5301 University Park Blvd., Oxford, OH 45056). The drive is TSD approved for distribution.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Food Resources Available for Families
item.description:
The Talawanda School District provides several food resources for families in need: - Little Free Pantries are available 24/7 outside every TSD building, restocked weekly or more - Backpack Program provides weekly food bags on Thursdays/Fridays at elementary buildings (contact your building Social Worker) - Emergency Food boxes available for pick-up or delivery within 24 hours - Additional resources include a calendar of community meals and TOPPS schedule, a list of all Butler County food pantries, and SNAP information

View original newsletter

item.title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
PUSH Program provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs. For more information or to apply, call Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 or visit push-oxford.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, OH 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly starts at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP required: scan the QR code or email Mrs. Croucher at croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, branch, and total number attending. Event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS and RSVP approval is required for attendance.

Veterans Day Breakfast

Veterans Day Assembly
Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: BRAVE Day for Sophomore Class
item.description:
BRAVE Day is Talawanda High School's annual family building, diversity, and anti-bullying event for sophomores only, taking place on Friday, November 14th. Students participate in activities and share stories to build community, realize they're not alone, and understand their important role with classmates. Attendance is optionalstudents who prefer not to participate should stay in their regular classes during the event.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting the Annual Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (5301 University Park Blvd, Oxford, Ohio 45056). Breakfast begins at 7:30 AM and the assembly starts at 9:00 AM. All veterans and one guest are invited to attend. RSVP is required - please scan the QR code or email croucherk@talawanda.org with the veteran's full name, military branch, and total number attending. Event is sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA & THS and RSVP approved for distribution.

item.title: FCCLA Blood Drive - Donate and Save Lives
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a blood drive on November 7, 2025 from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at the Talawanda High School Auxiliary Gym. Healthy individuals aged 16-65 can donate blood to help address the American blood shortage and support those needing blood for illnesses, transplants, and medical needs. The event is TSD approved for distribution, and participants will receive free snacks and a 1-hour rest period. For more information, contact +513-273-3200 or CROUCHERK@TALAWANDA.ORG.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Club Meetings for November 3-7
item.description:
Club meetings scheduled for the week of November 3-7: - Monday, Nov 3: Diversity Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 400), Setting Stone (2:30pm, room 320), Tribune (2:30pm, room 315) - Tuesday, Nov 4: NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315) - Wednesday, Nov 5: Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412) - Thursday, Nov 6: Best Buddies (Tutorial, Cafeteria), Chess Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Key Club (Tutorial, room 218), Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315), Project Green (2:30-3:30pm, room 224), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412) - Friday, Nov 7: Drama (2:30-5:30pm, PAC)

item.title: Winter EOC Testing Schedule and Information
item.description:
Individual Testing (December 3-5): For students needing to meet graduation requirements and first-time testers not currently enrolled in the class at THS. Contact Mrs. Hess for make-up testing.

Class Testing (December 16-19): Only for students currently taking Algebra C or Government classes, administered during exam week. Make-up testing available January 7-8.

Emails with specific test requirements and details will be sent to students and parents/guardians before Thanksgiving Break. Questions should be directed to Mrs. Hess at hessb@talawanda.org.
